description: Dive into "Whispers of Romance in Geneva" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Romance in Geneva

sources.snippet: A 360¬∞ panoramic view of the lake, the Jet d‚ÄôEau, the harbour and St. Peter‚Äôs Cathedral, what a delight!. Especially while enjoying a good lunch or fondue round the wood stove!. The Bains des P√¢quis (P√¢quis baths), a genuine peninsula on the lake, have always been a joy for Genevans and visitors alike.
sources.shortName: Sightseeing in Geneva: Views and Landmarks

sources.snippet: The Bains des P√¢quis (P√¢quis Bath) is a very important place in Geneva city life. In addition of being the ideal swimming spot in the heart of the city, it‚Äôs also very pleasant for its friendly and joyful atmosphere. Everyone, at every age, is coming here!.
sources.shortName: Visit Geneva: TOP 23 Things To Do and Must See

reviews.text:
Cost ‚Ç¨2 to swim in a beach that's literally right next to all that's hip and happening!! Great changing rooms, great swimming area, looked like everyone else had a great time too!!
And not that the beach gets credit, but the water was perfect temp.
I didn't try any other beaches in Geneva, but I got nothing bad to say about this one.

Nice place to swim, jump into Lake Geneva, play on kids playground and get food (fondu and more) and drinks. Parking is difficult though - - try the hotel garage a few blocks away. Cheap (2 Euros per person), yet if you leave, you'll have to pay to re-enter on the same day.

An exceptional place in the heart of Geneva city on the lake.
Beach and lake swimming pool in summer and a fabulous steam bath and sauna in winter time.
I can also highly recommend their restaurant with greate dishes and local specialtys in the very casual surrounding of the bath.

places.generalDescription: The Conservatory and Botanical Garden Geneva is a sprawling 28-hectare green space nestled in the heart of the city, near Ariana garden and Lake Geneva. It houses an impressive collection of nearly 16,000 plant species from around the world. Visitors can explore themed gardens, rockeries, and greenhouses that display a diverse range of flora.

sources.snippet: The Botanical Garden of Geneva is located between the Palais des Nations and Lake Geneva. Little known to tourists, it is an oasis of greenery that is worth a look after the visit to the United Nations headquarters.
sources.shortName: Visit Geneva: TOP 23 Things To Do and Must See

places.name: Conservatoire et Jardin botaniques de la Ville de Gen√®ve

reviews.text: I like visiting botanical gardens when I go on a city break and this has to rank amongst the best. Beautiful, well tended gardens very much with a natural focus but with more formal gardens too. Lovely meandering paths and water gardens as well as a fabulous set of green houses. Definitley worth a visit. We went twice in one long weekend. Was flowering when we were there but I am guessing the wisteria we saw coiled around a frame on the path with be something!

Botanical gardens of Geneva are huge and keep at least an hour to explore this place. It is impressive but tge greenhouses inside it are disappointing. Very narrow and less place. Also lacks varities of plants and colours. The entry to this place is free and if you love nature and have spare time you can come here and explore this place. It is very good but not a must visit place.

Entrance opposite Geneva Schengen station (there are several) Free entry.
I can't recommend this park enough. Absolutely stunning. Tbh, I was surprised how few people were there. This may have been down to the extremely high temperatures the area is experiencing (mid-August).

places.generalDescription: Promenade de la Treille, located behind Geneva's City Hall, offers stunning views of the Jura and Saleve mountain ranges as well as the city itself. It is home to the world's longest wooden bench, stretching an impressive 120m. The promenade exudes peace and tranquility, making it a must-visit for travelers in Geneva.

sources.snippet: The Treille Promenade (‚ÄúPromenade de la Treille‚Äù) is located on the outskirts of the old town, not far from the town hall. In addition to being the oldest in Geneva, it is especially known for its 2 curiosities:
sources.shortName: Visit Geneva: TOP 23 Things To Do and Must See

places.name: Promenade de la Treille

reviews.text:
Promenade de la Treille in Geneva is a hidden gem that offers a tranquil escape in the heart of the city. The iconic Treille vine-covered pergola, believed to be one of the longest in the world, creates a picturesque setting for a leisurely stroll.

Lined with charming benches and framed by vibrant flowers, the promenade provides stunning panoramic views of the city. The historic atmosphere, combined with the natural beauty of the surroundings, makes it an ideal spot for a peaceful retreat.

The sense of history is palpable as you walk through the trellised path, which is particularly enchanting during the blooming season. It's a perfect blend of nature and culture, offering a unique perspective on Geneva's landscape.

Whether you're seeking a quiet moment of reflection or a romantic walk with beautiful scenery, Promenade de la Treille is a must-visit. Its timeless charm and captivating views make it a true oasis within the bustling city.

Promenade de la Treille was built around 1515 as a platform for the defense of the city. In 1774, the famous Treille wooden bench was installed: with its 120 meters of length it's said to be the longest bench in the world. I came here attracted by this fact, but honestly I was a little disappointed because the view from here is nothing special: anyway it's a fine place to take a rest.

This is such a beautiful place to stroll on a calm sunny day! I loved the expansiveness of the walkway. It was a lovely spot to take in the waterfront as well as take pictures.

There are benches spread out to stop and really take in the beauty. If you want to reach this from the main street with the hotels, follow G Maps to get to the underpass that crosses the highway.

places.address: Rpe de la Treille, 1204 Gen√®ve, Switzerland

places.generalDescription: If you're in the mood for a delicious and luxurious lunch, La Micheline is the place to go. With an extensive wine cellar, this bistronomic establishment is beautiful inside and out. The food is truly exquisite, and the service is warm and welcoming.

sources.snippet: This bistronomic establishment, awarded 14/20 in the 2022 Swiss Gault&Millau, welcomes you for a gourmet meal in a hushed atmosphere and a most charming setting. This ode to love and contemporary elegance is reflected in the increasingly subtle creations of chef Andres Arocena. The plus: a wine cellar with more than 100 vintages!

sources.shortName: Romantic restaurants in Geneva | Geneva Tourism

places.name: La Micheline

reviews.text:
What a GEM in GENEVA !!!
I went there yesterday for a dinner with my wife for the 1st time.
We have been really positive surprised by the quality of the dinner.
The restaurant is very cozy, very nice ambience. Staff working in the restaurant are very welcoming and attentive to the tables and clients requests.

All the dishes were very well prepared and combination of flavors (for our taste) were excellent.

Considering the quality of ingredients and service the final price  was very reasonable.

Congratulations to all and thank you for providing such a good dinner experience to me and my wife.

Absolutely delicious tasting menu (we had 6 course menu) and incredible paring wine. Generous portions of everything, great and attentive service and incredible ambience. Towards the end we had a pleasure to meet Chef Andres, who is so amazing and friendly. Definitely a must visit for Geneva, and worth every penny.

Special place. The terrace is wonderful. The food was surprising, exciting and just delicious. The egg dessert, that's not even an egg! The amuse bouche olive explosion and the olive oil you want to slather yourself in its so good but instead you dip the homemade bread in it.
Love how relaxed yet attentive the staff are. Thanks for a wonderful evening.

places.address: Av. de la Gare des Eaux-Vives 3, 1207 Gen√®ve, Switzerland

places.generalDescription: L' Apart√©, located in Geneva, is a cozy and intimate restaurant with a capacity for only 15 guests. Chef Armel Bedouet, awarded a Michelin star in 2020, presents exquisite dishes personally to the privileged diners. The menu features creative recipes that elevate seasonal products such as stiffened langoustines and dry bacon from Valais.

sources.snippet: This is certainly the most atypical of the city‚Äôs starred restaurants. The gourmet establishment on the right bank charms and dazzles with its unique atmosphere and the prowess of its chef, Armel Bedouet. Awarded a star in 2021 and a 17/20 in the prestigious Gault&Millau Switzerland guide, L‚ÄôApart√© offers a unique sensory experience in a place that can only accommodate 15 privileged guests.

places.name: L' Apart√©

reviews.text: We had the taster menu along with the paired wines and it was a lovely evening. The service and presentation of the food was impeccable, and the venue itself is tastefully understated, calm and welcoming. The menu was full of surprises with delicious seasonal flavours and almost too beautiful to eat, with nice little touches like edible flowers.

I have travelled the world extensively over 40 years. I ate at all restaurants ranging from pop & mom's to Michelin three stars. This is my honest review of the restaurant L'Apart√©, inside Hotel Royal in Geneva, Switzerland.

An exceptional dining experience! We opted for the six-course surprise menu, which, along with two bottles of champagne, turned out to be very reasonably priced given the outstanding quality of the food.

The meal started with a variety of amuse-bouches, each offering distinct and vibrant flavors that awakened the palate. This was followed by two different starters, with the standout dish being a perfectly cooked scallop that left a lasting impression.

The main courses were equally remarkable. The cod fillet was beautifully prepared, enhanced by a variety of well-balanced flavors, while the pork from Jussy (Geneva canton) was exquisitely cooked and paired with a delightful sauce. In fact, every dish featured unique and carefully crafted sauces with spices that brought a refreshing twist to the flavors, creating a perfect harmony across the courses.

We opted for the cheese selection, which included four pre-selected cheeses. While we didn't get to choose them individually, the selection was interesting-though the order of tasting could be debated. Dessert preceded by a pre-dessert were both delicious, but the savory courses impressed me the most.

The service was impeccable, with the chef personally presenting each dish at the table. While he didn't speak English, a waiter seamlessly translated his explanations for the English speakers in our group. The staff was extremely attentive and welcoming, adding to the overall experience.

The restaurant's ambiance was elegant, with a beautifully crafted wooden table for six, offering both style and comfort. Tables were well spaced, allowing for relaxed conversations, and the decor was tastefully done.

As for parking, they offer a valet service, which can initially be a bit tricky to locate. However, by following the reception's directions, the valet service turned out to be efficient and convenient, providing quick access to the hotel.

Overall, a truly memorable evening-I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a refined and creative culinary experience!

Truly exceptional!

First, the food demonstrated thoughtfulness and skill. They perfectly accommodated our dietary restrictions - me being vegan and my husband allergic to shellfish - despite their usual menu that evening being heavy in shellfish. We did the seven course option and the food was better than some two and three star Michelin restaurants we've enjoyed. Perhaps the best meal we've had. The only course that fell flat for me was the 6th, the vegan pre-dessert, which was a dish of strawberries and strawberry gel. I like strawberries as much as the next person, but would have liked a little more variety in this dish. The best courses were the carrot carpaccio second course and the celeriac fourth course, both of which were downright phenomenal.

Second, the drinks! Their sommelier is personable and suggested great wines. The cocktails I enjoyed - a cucumber cocktail with gin and an espresso martini - were delicious pairings.

Third, the service - despite us having limited French skills, the chef visited our table to introduce every course, translated by the manager. The manager was also wonderful to chat with!

places.generalDescription: The Mus√©e d'Art et d'Histoire in Geneva, built in 1910, is the city's largest museum and offers a diverse collection spanning over 15,000 years of history. From prehistoric artifacts to modern paintings, the museum showcases a wide range of exhibits including Mesopotamian artifacts, ancient suits of armor, ornamental musical instruments, Coptic wall hangings, and a colossal statue of Pharaoh Ramses II.

sources.snippet: Located in Les Tranchees, the Mus√©e d'Art et d'Histoire dates back to 1826 as an organisation; however the present building was built in the beginning of the 20th century.
sources.shortName: Geneva, Switzerland  - Tourist Places & Top Things to Do in 2024

places.name: Mus√©e d'Art et d'Histoire

reviews.text:
The Mus√©e d'Art et d'Histoire in Geneva is an absolute must-visit for any tourist. Housed in a stunning neoclassical building, the museum impresses with its vast and varied collection-from ancient archaeological treasures and Swiss artists. The exhibits are thoughtfully arranged and cater to art lovers and casual visitors alike, with plenty to interest families and solo travelers.

I loved how the museum blends Geneva's history with global art, creating a fascinating cultural journey through the ages. With friendly staff, affordable or even free entry for the permanent collection, and a perfect central location, this museum is an easy and rewarding addition to any Geneva itinerary. Highly recommended for anyone wanting to experience the best of the city's art and culture!

The museum in Geneva was truly impressive in quality. Admission was free, but any payment seemed to go toward donations. Its extensive collection was refreshing and left no room for boredom. I highly recommend a visit.

First time visiting this museum and it was a great experience. The staff were warm and helpful, offering information on guided tours and donation options.
The location is excellent and easy to get to. It's a huge museum with great collections that are well-organized by theme.
A unique feature is the white bridge connecting the two buildings, which has an amazing view üòé. The museum is clean, and the toilets are clean too.
‚ÄãIt's also very accessible, with elevators and accessible toilets for wheelchair users. The numerous lockers were very convenient for storing our belongings. Having a restaurant on-site is a nice bonus.
Highly recommend a visit.

places.generalDescription: Caf√© Zinette is a charming gourmet spot located just a short distance from downtown Geneva in Lancy. This restaurant offers a delightful menu featuring creatively reimagined French classics, incorporating unique ingredients like asparagus, pastrami, and sea urchins. Housed in a small transformed building, the venue provides an intimate dining experience with only 4-5 tables per room. Guests praise the delicious food and recommend it for special occasions due to its warm reception and lovely terrace.

sources.snippet: With its romantic and slightly utopian, shaded terrace, the establishment serves as a gourmet haunt, only a few minutes from downtown Geneva. Located in Lancy, Caf√© Zinette delights foodies and epicureans with a delightful, flavour-filled menu and serves French classics, boldly revisited with ingredients such as asparagus, pastrami and sea urchins.

sources.shortName: Romantic restaurants in Geneva | Geneva Tourism

places.name: Caf√© Zinette

reviews.text: Top 3 dining experience in Geneve. Amazing kitchen, congratulations to the team. And lovely service. Not to mention the eclectic atmosphere's vibe and the rocker wine list. Definitely will be back
cute and casual restaurant with a delicious selection of vine and lovely terrasse at the back - staff is super friendly and food is good but a bit pricey

I have travelled the world extensively over 40 years. I ate at all restaurants ranging from pop & mom's to Michelin three stars. This is my honest review of Caf√© Zinette in Lancy. Well executed & qualitative french food. Worth a detour when nearby.

places.generalDescription: Located in the vibrant Eaux-Vives district, Eat Me Restaurant & Cocktail Bar offers a diverse selection of internationally inspired small plates in a lively atmosphere. Whether you're there for lunch, dinner, or cocktails, this establishment invites you to embark on a global culinary journey through its sharing-style dishes. From Barcelona bites to Tandoori treats and flame-grilled steak by celebrity chef Philippe Chevrier, the menu spans continents.

sources.snippet: In the Eaux-Vives district, Eat Me will charm your head and your belly with high-flying cocktails and shared dishes filled with international flavours. Original and colourful creations await in an urban and elegant atmosphere. To top your evening, don‚Äôt forget to try the Chocolate Brownie Crush‚Ä¶

sources.shortName: Romantic restaurants in Geneva | Geneva Tourism

places.name: Eat Me Restaurant & Cocktail Bar - Geneva

reviews.text:
Best cocktails in town !!!
It is more a cocktail bar than a restaurant. You can choose cocktails (very well done) and take small plates to share. The quality of food is excellent.

Highly recommended if you are looking for a place to have great cocktails and excellent small bites to pair with.

This Friday, we had dinner at Eat Me Restaurant. Unfortunately, our evening was overshadowed by several disappointing experiences, and the restaurant did not live up to our expectations.

Positives:
‚Ä¢The atmosphere was interesting and engaging.
‚Ä¢The music was great.
‚Ä¢There was a decent variety of dishes to choose from.

Negatives:
1.Upon being seated, we were politely reminded that we needed to vacate our table by 9 p.m. for the second seating, which was understandable. However, during the evening, the waiter reminded us of this three more times, and by 8:45 p.m., he was practically hovering over us to ensure we were getting ready to leave. This behavior was extremely frustrating and ruined the dining experience.
2.To our shock, the glasses were not replaced at all. After drinking champagne, we were served both white and red wine in the same glasses. This is unacceptable, especially for a restaurant positioning itself as a high-end establishment.
3.After dinner, we asked to be seated near the bar. However, the waiter together with the manager refused our request, claiming it would be ‚Äútoo tight‚Äù for us. This was outright rude, leaving a very negative impression.

In conclusion, the restaurant failed to meet the standards of a fine dining venue.

The best Geneva has to offer? I think so! What a magnificent dinner experience we had here! This place offers incredible drinks and sharing plates with flavors from all over the world. Our favorite places were ‚ÄúBone-In Shanghai‚Äù and ‚ÄúBarcelona Bites‚Äù. The runner up was ‚ÄúHit The Road Jack‚Äù. The interior and the atmosphere was really fitting and the music was really upbeat and fitting as well. We thoroughly enjoyed our time and will for sure come back. In the summer this place could use air conditioning but otherwise it was fabulous throughout.

places.generalDescription: Nagomi is a compact and unassuming restaurant located on Zurich Street in Geneva, known for its high-quality sushi, tempura, and other classic Japanese dishes. The restaurant offers a tiny yet authentic space with a capacity of around ten people, making reservations essential. While slightly pricier than other options, Nagomi is not just a sushi bar but also a full-fledged Japanese restaurant offering unique dishes that are hard to find elsewhere in the city.

sources.snippet: A true Japanese restaurant in the middle of a hectic neighborhood. You will be transported to Japan immediately and feel like in a completely different city and atmosphere. There is not a better place to eat raw fish and Sushi!

places.name: Nagomi

reviews.text:
I have travelled the world extensively over 40 years. I ate at all restaurants ranging from pop & mom's to Michelin three stars. This is my honest review of the restaurant Nagomi.

I had the pleasure of dining at this Japanese restaurant located near the train station in Geneva, and it was an exceptional experience. The menu is impressively extensive, offering a wide variety of fish and seafood for sashimi and sushi. Every selection I made was of outstanding quality, with prime freshness that truly stood out.

The miso soup and green tea were perfect companions to the meal, offering a comforting warmth on a cold day. The interior is simple and unpretentious, as one might expect from an authentic Japanese establishment, but I particularly appreciated the counter seating. It was a delight to watch the sushi chef at work, adding an extra layer of authenticity to the experience.

Finally, the price-to-value ratio was very good, making it a highly satisfying meal overall. I wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking quality Japanese cuisine in Geneva.

I wonder if the Genevoises know how lucky they are to have such an authentic Japanese restaurant!!!!! A tempura ya in Europe!?!?!?! We are from the San Francisco Bay Area California and there is no tempura ya where we come from. üòì We came to Nagomi two days in a row, first to the sushi restaurant operated by the dad, then the tempura ya operated by the son. The tempura was cooked piece by piece in front of us, just like in Japan.  Thank you for the amazing food.

Best sushi in Geneva and very authentic. Amazing choice on the menu. One should go and explore new products. Everything was prepared delicately and items were very fresh. Reasonable price for the quality.

places.generalDescription: Nestled just a stone's throw from the train station in the vibrant Paquis district, Ciro is a culinary gem that beckons food lovers with its delightful offerings. This charming establishment specializes in authentic southern Italian cuisine, artfully blending local ingredients with traditional recipes. The menu is refreshingly dynamic, changing daily based on market availability and the chef‚Äôs creative inspiration. Ciro boasts a cozy atmosphere where conviviality reigns supreme, making it an ideal spot for both casual dining and special occasions.

sources.snippet: The cutest Italian Trattoria, a couple of tables, a checkered tablecloth and traditional Italian food. Check, check, check for a romantic dinner!. Neighbourhood: Paquis

places.name: Ciro

reviews.text: It was warm and intimate with delicious plates to match. Very grateful to the kitchen and staff for setting the new year off right. Great for all occasions!

Food was undeniably tasty - perfectly al dente pasta, served with a subtly spicy tomato sauce. However, the overall experience was disappointing due to the excessive wait time (over an hour!). Our dishes didn't arrive at the same time, and one of us had to wait even longer, despite other tables who arrived after us being served first. On top of that, we were seated next to the door, which was constantly left open, making it uncomfortably chilly.

In short, while we enjoyed the food, the long wait and lack of attention to comfort and service made the experience not worth returning.

Feel bad posting a mediocre review as my first (lunch) experience of this restaurant was very good. But unfortunately we did not have a good experience coming here on a busy weekend dinner service.

The service although polite was very slow, with the wine only coming on second asking with the food taking a good part of one hour between starter and mains. This seemed to be across the whole restaurant as the table next to us who ordered at the same time did not have their main course by the time we left.

Further to this the food itself was hit and miss, the prawn calamari although looking spectacular (with prawn heads and all) was soggy and poorly executed. The lobster pasta tasted mainly of cream and not much else. The rock fish and arancini however were very good (fish cooked perfectly flakey and arancini crispy) and would happily eat again.

It is a charming Italian bistro providing more than just the standard pasta and pizza choices that you see so much of in Geneva making this particular all the more disappointing. However there are many decent eateries in the area and so they need to be more consistent. I want to come again and be proven wrong and will be more than happy to change my review but for now hope my review will be learnt from rather than ignored.

places.generalDescription: La Favola is an intimate Italian restaurant that offers a wide range of dishes, such as tortellini. The food is delicious and the service is excellent. The restaurant is located on a hill and this makes it a nice walk up for the food and a cosy walk down to help digest afterwards.

sources.snippet: Two cozy floors of romantic tables, serving delicious Italian specialities. Located in the heart of the Old Town of Geneva, you can walk there to make it extra romantic!. Neighbourhood: Old Town

places.name: La Favola

reviews.text:
Authentic Italian food and reasonable prices. Wonderful ambiance of a small family run business. It's not the largest restaurant, but not cramped either.

We had the boar ragu with papardele and the truffles risotto.  Both were incredible.  The risotto was al dente and creamy with an abundance of shaved truffles. The boar ragu was with some vegetables and was delicate, tender and light. The sauce and pasta blended seamlessly.

Overall a splendid menu with a great wine selection as well. Enjoy!

A gem of a restaurant hidden in the old town of Geneva.
My father and I were looking for an Italian for dinner and wanted to go somewhere new. We  found this place and decided to go and try it out. Best decision ever.
The food was wonderful, the service was great and they had a good choice of wines.
We were both very impressed and will be adding it to our list of places to eat on our Father/ Daughter dinners as well as recommending to friends and visitors.

Very cozy atmosphere in the old town of Geneva. The service and the kitchen were excellent, and perhaps one of the best in Geneva. For a person who loves a delicious meal with a family or your partner either for lunch or dinner, this place is the right place for you. Moreover, we want to thank the owner of the restaurant for her hospitality and recommendations. We really enjoyed our dining experience, and will most certainly come back again.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Geneva, the Mus√©e Barbier-Mueller is a treasure trove for art enthusiasts and cultural explorers alike. This remarkable museum showcases an impressive collection of over 7,000 artworks and artifacts that span various tribal cultures and classical antiquity. The origins of this captivating collection can be traced back to two passionate collectors, Joseph Mueller and Jean Paul Barbier, who dedicated their lives to unearthing extraordinary pieces from Africa, Asia, Oceania, and beyond.

sources.snippet: If you choose to visit this museum for a romantic date, there‚Äôll be plenty of talking points as you pass exhibits.
sources.shortName: 21 Romantic Things to do in Geneva for Couples [2024]

places.name: Mus√©e Barbier-Mueller

reviews.text: I had an amazing experience at this hidden gem in the heart of Geneva's charming Old Town! With its soft lighting, the museum has an intimate atmosphere that enhances the Indigenous art on display. You'll find objects from all over the world, something that you won't find in other usual museums. It truly offers a chance to explore different cultures and on top of that, the staff is incredibly welcoming and friendly, making the visit even more enjoyable. Definitely a must-see for anyone in Geneva!

It's a bit expensive private collection not a museum. As such not very rich though intetesting. It takes no more than 30 minutes to watch everything. Including the completaly appendix glass art objects.

If you think all these African and Oceanian mask are not your thing, visit this museum: small, very well presented. And they have seats in every exhibition room (and flex ones that you can carry)!
Recommended!

places.name: Jardin botanique alpin de Meyrin

reviews.text:
This small park is a fantastic example of Alpine planting, amongst others. I was amazed to see unprotected Musa Basjoo and Tetrapanax (in the UK, we would wrap them for winter).

There's a range of habitat, from the urban farm to mature trees, and from dry river beds to beehives. I saw a buzzard nesting in a tree, a stone's throw from the airport. Whoever maintains this special place is doing a great job.

A very welcome place to spend an hour wandering and collecting my thoughts before flying home. And it's free.
Nice place, it's a shame that you can hear car noises from the garden

Wow, the Alpine botanical garden is a hidden gem! Amazing place for a walk and relax in the nature while your are still near an airport in a busy city (you can here the city noises). It is small but there are many different flowers, plats, trees, bees and even goats. It is very well maintained. Calm and kid friendly place. The entrance is completely free. I am amazed it is not so popular among tourists - definitely worth visiting it!

places.address: Chem. du Jardin Alpin 9, 1217 Meyrin, Switzerland

places.generalDescription: Il Lago is an upscale Italian restaurant located within a luxurious hotel, boasting a Michelin star for its high-quality cuisine. Situated by the stunning Lake Geneva, the restaurant offers authentic Italian dishes made with locally sourced fresh ingredients. The dining room features elegant decor with light blue walls, beautiful chandeliers, and bright frescos, creating a blend of traditional and contemporary ambiance.

sources.snippet: Within the sumptuous Four Seasons Hotel des Bergues, Il Lago transports you to northern Italy for a wonderful getaway. Chef Massimiliano Sena seduces with his refined, elegant and breathtaking creations in a magical, velvety and intimate setting. Among the chef‚Äôs signature dishes are Pappardelle with Breton lobster or Rack of lamb from Vessy with parmesan ice cream.

places.name: Il Lago

reviews.text:
We are staying at the Four Seasons Geneva and ordered Il Lago into our room, it was absolutely tremendous. This 1 Michelin star restaurant delivers on every level. Highly recommend and would absolutely go back.

The ingredients were of the absolute highest quality. I've spent weeks in Italy and have dined at many fine restaurants, this was some of the freshest tasting pasta I've ever had. The burrata was exceptional as well.

Also, order the tiramisu and the strawberry dessert. They were both incredible. If staying at the hotel, you absolutely must book this restaurant. If the service and quality was this good as room service, imagine how amazing it must be in the restaurant. The enter staff was flawless. 10/10

Overall pleasant lunch, great service and attentive. As advice I suggest to not sit close to the entrance as I asked to close the door due to the noise from the bar but they said that the entrance had to stay open... The food is high quality, well presented small portions, I personally liked everything except the tiramisu that I would have kept on a traditional way, this kind of semifreddo was not tasty and difficult to eat. Instead very suggested is the affogato!! Overall I recommend but for the price, I was a little upset by these two aforementioned things.

An unbeatable buffet brunch experience. You really just want to eat it all. The presentation is impeccable and the food itself is top notch. A special thank you to the door man at the Ritz Carlton who directed us here as the Living Room at the Ritz was fully booked. An even extra big thank you to the door man at The Four Seasons who ushered us in on arrival and took us straight to Il Lago because he knew the experience we were looking for.
